DOC.brief_summary: This study focuses on the difficulties to maintain a weight loss and behavioural change after having been in a institutional intermittent weight loss programme. We explore if including a member of the family or a close friend in the treatment influences weight loss maintenance after completion of the programme.
DOC.brief_title: Family & Friends - the Significance of a Significant Other in Treatment
DOC.criteria: Morbid obesity 1850 years of age Having a relative or close friend who is willing to participate Pregnancy Serious mental illness Severe overeating behaviour Significant reduced physical functioning Having undergone bariatric surgery earlier Serious heart disease
